Help & Advice

How to Spot a Scam

Scammers often use urgency, unsolicited contact, or requests for unusual payment methods (e.g., crypto, gift cards). Look for inconsistencies in communication, unverifiable identities, or offers that seem too good to be true.

What to Do If You’ve Been Scammed

Contact your bank immediately to report the fraud and attempt to stop or reverse transactions. Report the incident to Action Fraud at 0300 123 2040. Gather evidence like messages or receipts for your report.

Trusted Prevention Tips

  • Use strong, unique passwords for all accounts.
  • Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) wherever possible.
  • Consider protective registration with CIFAS to flag your identity.

When to Contact Your Bank

Reach out if you’ve made a suspicious payment, notice unauthorized transactions, or receive unusual account security alerts. Act quickly—most banks have 24/7 fraud lines.

Useful Resources

Action Fraud - Report scams and get advice.
GOV.UK Fraud Reporting - Official guidance and reporting tools.

); } export default HelpAndAdvice;
